ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: for establishing WOMEN EMPOWERMENT CENTRE to be set up with the help of local government administration to facilitate Un-employed & Un-skilled girl child to generate income and employment & become self- dependent through the SKILL DEVELOPMENT PROGRAMME and make an individual village as a digital village The need for giving emphasis on the Skill Development, especially for the less educated, poor and out of school girl child has been highlighted by Gyanodaya team because we felt that Earlier it was happen that only one person in a home (ie MUKHIYA) earn in a family and women of that time be in a home and engaged in managing home activities. But now the scenario has been totally changed, Globalization has presented new challenges for the realization of the goal of womens equality, the gender impact of which has not been systematically evaluated &the expenses& responsibilities has been increased at extreme level and the income of an individual is not sufficient for the survival.Its a time that both men & women work together and make the future of the INDIA because if a single women be educated & skill then she will not only become a earning participant in a family but she also plays a vital role in making her child career by her skills & experience .Women empowerment has a strengthened for prevention of women violence , including sexual harassment at work place and customs like dowry; for the rehabilitation of the victims of violence and for taking effective action against the perpetrators of such violence a women must have to be skilled &self dependent

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: NGO It has been registered under the societies act 1973 in the year 2001. After knowing the importance of handicrafts, adopted jute craft to help the poor and need in getting their lively hood. First of all providing the free training and engaged them by providing job works. Gradually he works have been extended to rural areas to provide the means of lively hood. As such, Diwanganj village has been chosen. Move then 200 female candidates has been trained in very skilled manner. Got the schemes of AHVY, starting from training, design development workshop and organization of exhibition. And finally the integrated design development project. The mass production is required to publish. As Such, the publicity is more required. Finally brochure printing project has been sanctioned. The dedicated jute works and creation of new designs and variety range of products have fulfilled the present brochure printing. At first intervention only one training program me ATS-A for six month was sanctioned in jute articles and was started w.e.f. 23.02.05 and running properly. It is felt that a numerous intervention is needed to bring the SHGs at par. However NGO requested to form implement Design Development workshop for their design and Technical Development for production through the artisans of SHGs. Further desires to organize AHVY  Exhibition scheme to explore the newly reproduced products, However, the NGO is in dire need of the above scheme to develop the NGO and to uplift the SHGs who are linked with the NGO. Accordingly, NGO is submitting the integrated development project proposal for rural, poor and minority artisans of Diwanganj, Distt. Raisen (M.P) for consideration. For this purpose NGO has the manpower and infrastructure facilities like tools, loom etc. to run the schemes without any trouble and prove the event as colourful and result oriented one. After the completion of the above scheme the NGO is planning to from more SHGs with the local trained artisans. All these efforts are being fulfilled through AHVY

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: 1. Onsite free school education to more than 200 tribal children in Daynand Vidhya Niketan established at the Ashram HQ in Village Sidhpur (Hoshangabad). More than 100 students living in Ashram hostel and are being provided free catering etc. and books. 2. Free education for 70 tribal children in satellite school in other nearby villages 3. More than 100 children being educated free in different Balwadis being run by the Ashram. 4. Vocatinal training of local tribal students on Floor Mill established by the Ashram for this purpose. 5 Free medical check up and care of tribal poor through annual camps 6. Old Age home with free amenities at the Ashram for destitute women and elderly tribal poo. 7. Annual matrimonial conventions for mass marriages and financial help for tribal girls 8. Annual Mahila Jagriti Shivir and Sewing Centre for training of tribal women. 9. Gau Sewa and creating awareness about it. 10. Organisation of national festivals and local cultrual events to inculcate the feelings of togetherness.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Jan Shikshan Sansthan sponsored by Ministry of HRD was Sanctioned on 21st March 2005 in tribal district Dhar with view of covering Illiterate and Neo literate from last four years we are regularly organizing vocational training of there need so that they should do self employment and employment we receiving good response from rural as well as urban areas where our programme team conduct survey and identification of core group and motivate them to learn some skill along with basic knowledge of education. We also do some important activities of awareness about health education and HIV AIDS besides this. We also organize Exhibition of our handcraft item made by beneficiaries through which they get money benefit along with enthusiasm our few Exhibition were well appreciated by people who attended awareness about HIV AIDS Hazards we campaigned through small demonstration of Nukkad Natak and Ralies.
